Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
The class Date represents the date information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Date​(int m, int d, int y)
    This constructor initializes the month, date and year of a date, based on the given parameters.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getDay()
    This method returns the day of the date.
    int getMonth()
    This method returns the month of the date.
    int getYear()
    This method returns the year of the date.
    boolean isValidDate​(int m, int d, int y)
    This method checks if the given date information is valid
    void setDay​(int d)
    This method sets the day of the date.
    void setMonth​(int m)
    This method sets the month of the date.
    void setYear​(int y)
    This method sets the month of the date.
    java.lang.String toString()
    This method returns a concatenation of the month, day and year of the date.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Date

      public Date​(int m, int d, int y)
      This constructor initializes the month, date and year of a date, based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      m - month of the given date
      d - day of the given date
      y - year of the given date

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a concatenation of the month, day and year of the date. For example: 8 / 31 / 2020
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      concatenation of the month, day and year of the date

    • isValidDate

      public boolean isValidDate​(int m, int d, int y)
      This method checks if the given date information is valid
      Parameters:
      m - month of the given date
      d - day of the given date
      y - year of the given date
      Returns:
      true if the given date information are valid, otherwise false
